message.content:
cs.NI, cs.IT, cs.DC, cs.SY, cs.CR 

This paper is likely to belong to the Computer Science sub-category of Network and Internet Architecture (cs.NI) as it discusses the emerging Information-Centric Networking (ICN) architectures and proposes a framework for joint design of forwarding, caching, and congestion control strategies within the Named Data Networking (NDN) architecture. Additionally, the paper also discusses the delay performance of the proposed algorithms, which is a key aspect of network and internet architecture. 

The paper may also belong to the sub-category of Information Theory (cs.IT) as it discusses the optimization of network throughput and utility, which are key concepts in information theory. 

The sub-category of Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing (cs.DC) is also a likely fit as the paper discusses the joint design of forwarding, caching, and congestion control strategies, which are key aspects of distributed computing. 

The sub-category of Systems and Control (cs.SY) may also be relevant as the paper discusses the use of Lyapunov drift techniques to prove the throughput optimality and characterize the utility-delay tradeoff of the proposed algorithms, which are key concepts in control theory. 

Finally, the sub-category of Cryptography and Security (cs.CR) may also be relevant as the paper discusses the optimization of network performance while ensuring security and privacy of the content being distributed over the network.
